name: Reality TV me
description: Cult documentary Grey Gardens follows the everyday eccentricities of mother and daughter Big Edie and Little Edie. The women perform and speak candidly to the camera, and have been described as predecessors to reality TV stars.

key_work.title: Documenting reality
key_work.brief_description: Documentary has evolved from educational newsreels and public service announcements to the experimental cinéma vérité (‘truthful cinema’), docuseries and online videos. They have also been used to spread propaganda and influence society, projecting interpretations of the truth that highlight the problematic relationship between cinema and reality.

constellations_primary.name: Reality TV me

start.title: RuPaul's Drag Race
start.brief_description: Join RuPaul, the world’s most famous drag queen in the ultimate drag competition. America’s top drag queens vie for drag stardom as RuPaul, in full glamazon drag, reigns supreme in all judging and eliminations while helping guide the contestants.

constellations_other.description: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert is a groundbreaking Australian film with a small budget and big impact that's taken queer Australian stories to the world.

end.title: Keeping Up with the Kardashians

end.brief_description: A peek inside the exploits and privileged private lives of the blended Kardashian-Jenner family, including sisters Kim, Kourtney and Khloé.

constellations_other.name: If at first you don't succeed
constellations_other.description: Though originally intended as a laugh, Celeste Baber’s social media posts have become examples of body positivity to her eight million followers and challenge the absurd expectations put on women in society.

constellations_other.description: James Turrell's immersive artworks have an unusual connection with Saturday Night Live, hip hop and reality TV royalty.

links.description: The Kardashians have also been impersonated on Ru Paul’s Drag Race, and Khloe Kardashian has featured as a celebrity guest judge. The Kardashians are known for their reality TV show and have leveraged an entire empire off their public personas.

links.description: Kim Kardashian appears in husband Kanye West’s music video ‘Famous’, which controversially included the apparently naked bodies (wax figures) of celebrities Taylor Swift, Anna Wintour, George W Bush and Rihanna, amongst others.

end.title: UnREAL
end.brief_description: Set against the backdrop of a hit dating competition show, “UnREAL” is led by Rachel, a young staffer whose sole job is to manipulate her relationships with and among the contestants to get the vital dramatic and outrageous footage the program’s dispassionate executive producer demands.

constellations_other.name: Reality TV me
constellations_other.description: Cult documentary Grey Gardens follows the everyday eccentricities of mother and daughter Big Edie and Little Edie. The women perform and speak candidly to the camera, and have been described as predecessors to reality TV stars.

links.description: TV drama UnREAL follows a producer on a reality dating show, revealing the machinations and manipulations of ‘reality’ behind such shows as The Bachelor and Love Island.

start.title: Grey Gardens
start.creator_credit: Muffie Meyer, Albert Maysles and David Maysles
start.brief_description: Edie Bouvier Beale and her mother, Edith, two aging, eccentric relatives of Jackie Kennedy Onassis, are the sole inhabitants of a Long Island estate. The women reveal themselves to be misfits with outsized, engaging personalities. Much of the conversation is centered on their pasts, as mother and daughter now rarely leave home.

constellations_other.name: Film-truth
constellations_other.description: The experimental documentary Man with a Movie Camera has had a lasting impact on the development of film styles.

constellations_other.description: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert is a groundbreaking Australian film with a small budget and big impact that's taken queer Australian stories to the world.

links.description: In 2013, Jinkx Monsoon brilliantly impersonated Little Edie from Grey Gardens, who has become a queer icon, on an episode of Ru Paul’s Drag Race featuring segment ‘Snatch Game’, itself a parody of TV quiz show Match Game.

end.title: Ingrid Goes West
end.creator_credit: Adam Mirels, Aubrey Plaza, Jared Ian Goldman, Robert Mirels, Tim White, Trevor White and Mighty Engine

video_links.name: INGRID GOES WEST [Theatrical Trailer] – In Theaters August 11th
Ingrid Goes West [Trailer] Red Band Trailer // In Theaters August 11th
Ingrid Goes West [Trailer] World Emoji Day Trailer // In Theaters August 11th

end.brief_description: Ingrid becomes obsessed with a social network star named Taylor Sloane who seemingly has a perfect life. But when Ingrid decides to drop everything and move west to be Taylor’s friend, her behaviour turns unsettling and dangerous.

constellations_other.name: Reality TV me
constellations_other.description: Cult documentary Grey Gardens follows the everyday eccentricities of mother and daughter Big Edie and Little Edie. The women perform and speak candidly to the camera, and have been described as predecessors to reality TV stars.

links.description: Where Kim Kardashian and her sisters have capitalised on the rise of social media, the film Ingrid Goes West explores the dark underbelly of platforms like Facebook and Instagram as Aubrey Plaza’s character obsesses over and stalks influencer Taylor.

start.title: Documenting reality
start.brief_description: Documentary has evolved from educational newsreels and public service announcements to the experimental cinéma vérité (‘truthful cinema’), docuseries and online videos. They have also been used to spread propaganda and influence society, projecting interpretations of the truth that highlight the problematic relationship between cinema and reality.

constellations_primary.name: Reality TV me
constellations_primary.description: Cult documentary Grey Gardens follows the everyday eccentricities of mother and daughter Big Edie and Little Edie. The women perform and speak candidly to the camera, and have been described as predecessors to reality TV stars.

end.title: Grey Gardens
end.creator_credit: Muffie Meyer, Albert Maysles and David Maysles
end.brief_description: Edie Bouvier Beale and her mother, Edith, two aging, eccentric relatives of Jackie Kennedy Onassis, are the sole inhabitants of a Long Island estate. The women reveal themselves to be misfits with outsized, engaging personalities. Much of the conversation is centered on their pasts, as mother and daughter now rarely leave home.

constellations_other.name: Reality TV me
constellations_other.description: Cult documentary Grey Gardens follows the everyday eccentricities of mother and daughter Big Edie and Little Edie. The women perform and speak candidly to the camera, and have been described as predecessors to reality TV stars.

constellations_other.name: Film-truth
constellations_other.description: The experimental documentary Man with a Movie Camera has had a lasting impact on the development of film styles.

links.description: Documentarians develop camera techniques to access, interpret and compose notions of truth. Direct cinema, which Albert and David Maysles’ interpreted as an intimate ‘fly-on-the-wall’ style was used in their acclaimed film Grey Gardens, which foresaw the techniques used in reality TV.

end.title: Gillian Wearing: Editing Life
end.brief_description: Inspired by documentaries, reality TV and the performative nature of identity, British artist Gillian Wearing describes her approach to photography and video as “editing life”. Presented for PHOTO 2022 International Festival of Photography, Wearing turns the lens on herself to contemplate the nature of ageing in the contemporary world.

constellations_other.name: Reality TV me
constellations_other.description: Cult documentary Grey Gardens follows the everyday eccentricities of mother and daughter Big Edie and Little Edie. The women perform and speak candidly to the camera, and have been described as predecessors to reality TV stars.

links.description: Gillian Wearing’s work is inspired by documentary and reality TV. By putting herself in the frame of her work, she questions the superficial aspects of how we relate to each other through media, the nature of performance, and the line between our public and private lives.
